messageBody:
I wonder if list members might wish to share current strategies for
unit testing of EJB, particularly CMP Entity Beans.

I'm aware of Cactus, and have tested EJB in the past (Session Beans)
using Cactus. Also, I'm aware of junitejb, which again seems geared
towards testing through a session bean interface.

In many ways, I think the issues i'm facing are those discussed often
on this list regarding testing of database code.

I have a set of entity beans (CMP2.0) with a Stateless Session Bean
facade, and a business delegate (plain old java object) fronting the
stateless session bean. I'd like to call all my tests through my
business delegate, as the Entity Bean is largely code-generated by
the container anyway, and the functionality I'm really interested
in testing is my invoking of the methods with value objects.

However, since i have no guarantee of the order my tests are run in,
I need to cleardown the persisted entities between each test; I've
written a DBTestCase in the past that performs a cleardown of tables
in the setUp() method, and allows each test to insert rows, modify
rows, delete rows, etc, and assert on entries existing in the
database.

What strategies have people successfully employed for testing
business/workflow methods of a stateless session bean that has
CMP entity beans at the back-end ?

Thanks,

Steven
